definitions.text: an accidental hole that allows something (fluid or light etc.) to enter or escape
examples: one of the tires developed a leak

definitions.text: soft watery rot in fruits and vegetables caused by fungi

examples: he had to take a leak

definitions.text: the discharge of a fluid from some container
examples: they tried to stop the escape of gas from the damaged pipe
he had to clean up the leak

definitions.text: unauthorized (especially deliberate) disclosure of confidential information

examples: The news were leaked to the paper
The news leaked out despite his secrecy

definitions.text: enter or escape as through a hole or crack or fissure
examples: Water leaked out of the can into the backpack

definitions.text: have an opening that allows light or substances to enter or go out
